sen.j: 南法華寺（みなみほっけじ）は、奈良県高市郡高取町にある真言宗の寺院。
sen.e: Minamihokke-ji Temple located in Takatori-cho, Takaichi-gun, Nara Prefecture is a temple of the Shingon sect.
Minamihokke-ji Temple located in Takatori-cho, Takaichi-gun, Nara Prefecture is a temple of the Shingon sect.
Minamihokke-ji Temple located in Takatori-cho, Takaichi-gun, Nara Prefecture is a temple of the Shingon sect.

sen.j: 山号は壺阪山。
sen.e: Its sango (literally, "mountain name"), the title prefixed to the name of a Buddhist temple, is Tsubosakazan.
Its sango (prefix of a Buddhist temple) is Tsubosaka-san.
sen.cmt: sango (prefix of a Buddhist temple) is Tsubosaka-san. としました。
sen.e: Its sango (prefix of a Buddhist temple) is Tsubosaka-san.

sen.j: 一般には壺阪寺（つぼさかでら）の通称で知られる。
sen.e: It is commonly known as Tsubosaka-dera Temple.
It is commonly known as Tsubosaka-dera Temple.
It is commonly known as Tsubosaka-dera Temple.

sen.j: 703年（大宝3年）創建と伝え、西国三十三箇所第六番札所。
sen.e: Reported to have been founded in 703, it is the 6th fudasho (temples where amulets are collected) of Saigoku Sanjusankasho (the 33 temples that are visited during the Kansai Kannon Pilgrimage).
Reported to have been founded in 703, it is the stamp office for temple number 6 of Saigoku Sanjusankasho (the 33 temples that are visited during the Kansai Kannon Pilgrimage).
sen.cmt: 第六番札所：the stamp office for temple number 6 (統一用語リストに従いました。
sen.e: Reported to have been founded in 703, it is the stamp office for temple number 6 of Saigoku Sanjusankasho (the 33 temples that are visited during the Kansai Kannon Pilgrimage).

sen.j: 本尊十一面観音は眼病に霊験があるといわれる。
sen.e: Its honzon (principal image of Buddha), Juichimen Kannon-zo (the statue of Eleven-faced Kannon), is believed to have miraculous efficacy of treating eye diseases.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Its honzon (principal image of Buddha), Juichimen Kannon-zo (the statue of Eleven-faced Kannon), is believed to have miraculous efficacy of treating eye diseases.
Its honzon (principal image of Buddha), Juichimen Kannon-zo (the statue of Eleven-faced Kannon), is believed to have miraculous efficacy of treating eye diseases.

sen.j: お里・沢市の夫婦愛をうたった人形浄瑠璃『壺坂霊験記』の舞台としても有名。
sen.e: It is also famous for a setting of a ningyo joruri(traditional Japanese puppet theater) titled "Tsubozaka Reigenki" that describes conjugal between Osato and Sawaichi.
It is also famous for a setting of a ningyo joruri(traditional Japanese puppet theater) titled "Tsubosaka Reigenki" that describes conjugal affection between Osato and Sawaichi.
It is also famous for a setting of a ningyo joruri(traditional Japanese puppet theater) titled "Tsubosaka Reigenki" that describes conjugal affection between Osato and Sawaichi.

sen.j: 園内には養護盲老人ホーム慈母園がある。
sen.e: Elderly nursing home Jiboen is in the precinct.
Elderly nursing home Jiboen is on the temple's ground.
sen.cmt: on the temple's ground. としました。
sen.e: Elderly nursing home Jiboen is on the temple's ground.

sen.j: 先代住職のインドでの救ハンセン病事業への尽力に対する返礼として贈られた「天竺渡来大観音像」がある。
sen.e: It has "Tenjiku Torai Daikannon Zo," a statue donated in return for the former a chief priest's contributions to anti-Hansen's disease activities in India
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: It has a statue of Goddess of Mercy called 'Tenjiku Torai Daikannon Zo,' donated in return for the contribution of the former chief to anti-Hansen's disease activities in India
sen.cmt: Tenjiku Torai Daikannon Zo,→ Goddess of Mercy called 'Tenjiku Torai Daikannon Zo,'
sen.e: It has a statue of Goddess of Mercy called 'Tenjiku Torai Daikannon Zo,' donated in return for the contribution of the former chief to anti-Hansen's disease activities in India

sen.j: 大理石造り、高さ約20m、総重量1200トンの壮大なもの。
sen.e: Its marble-made statue is magnificent with about 20 meter of height and a gross weight of 1200 tons.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Its marble statue is magnificent with about 20 m of height and a gross weight of 1,200 t.
sen.cmt: 指示書に従い単位の修正をしました。20 meter→20 m1200 tons→1,200 t
sen.e: Its marble statue is magnificent with about 20 m of height and a gross weight of 1,200 t.

sen.j: その他、インド渡来のものとしては、石像大仏伝図、天竺渡来大石堂がある。
sen.e: It has also articles from India: a large stone Butsudenzu (Illustrated Biographies of the Buddha) and large Tenjiku Torai Ishido.
It has other objects brought from India: a large stone relief, Butsudenzu (Illustrated Biographies of the Buddha), and Tenjiku Torai Ishido (an Indian-style large stone hall).
sen.cmt: also→otherarticles from India→objects brought from Indiaa large stone Butsudenzu→a large stone relief, Butsudenzularge stone Tenjiku Torai Ishido→Tenjiku Torai Ishido (an Indian-style large stone hall)
sen.e: It has other objects brought from India: a large stone relief, Butsudenzu (Illustrated Biographies of the Buddha), and Tenjiku Torai Ishido (an Indian-style large stone hall).

sen.j: 草創については不明な点が多い。
sen.e: It remains unknown how it was inaugurated.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: It remains unknown how it was founded.
It remains unknown how it was founded.

sen.j: 伝承によれば大宝 (日本)3年（703年）に元興寺の弁基上人により開かれたとされる。
sen.e: According to a tradition, it was founded by Benki Shonin of Gango-ji Temple in 703.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: According to a tradition, it was founded by Benki Shonin of Gango-ji Temple in 703.
According to a tradition, it was founded by Benki Shonin of Gango-ji Temple in 703.

sen.j: 京都の清水寺の北法華寺に対し南法華寺という。
sen.e: It is also called Minami Hokke-ji Temple, compared with Kiyomizu-dera Temple also known as Kita Hokke-ji Temple.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: It is also called Minami (south) Hokke-ji Temple, while Kiyomizu-dera Temple is known as Kita (north) Hokke-ji Temple.
sen.cmt: 南と北の対になっていることがわかるようにしました。
sen.e: It is also called Minami (south) Hokke-ji Temple, while Kiyomizu-dera Temple is known as Kita (north) Hokke-ji Temple.

sen.j: 長谷寺とともに古くから観音霊場として栄えた。
sen.e: It flourished as a sacred place of Kannon along with Hase-dera Temple since for long.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: It flourished as a sacred place of Kannon Pilgrimage along with Hase-dera Temple since for long.
sen.cmt: 観音霊場：sacred place of Kannon →sacred place of Kannon Pilgrimage
sen.e: It flourished as a sacred place of Kannon Pilgrimage along with Hase-dera Temple since for long.

sen.j: 岩をたて 水をたたえて 壺阪の 庭にいさごも 浄土なるらん
sen.e: The garden in Tsubosaka with rocks and plenty of water, although caddiswroms are around, is just like Jodo (the Buddhist Elysian Fields).
The garden in Tsubosaka with rocks and plenty of water and paved with fine-grained gravel, it is just like Jodo (the Pure Land).
sen.cmt: , although caddiswroms are around, is → and paved with fine-grained gravel, it is just like Jodo (the Pure Land)
sen.e: The garden in Tsubosaka has rocks and plenty of water and is paved with fine-grained gravel; it is just like Jodo (the Pure Land).
sen.cmt: 動詞を追加して文にしました。

sen.j: 本堂－江戸時代の再建
sen.e: Main hall: It was rebuilt in the Edo period.
Hondo (main hall): It was rebuilt in the Edo period.
Hondo (main hall): It was rebuilt in the Edo period.

sen.j: 礼堂－室町時代中期以前の建立。
sen.e: Rai-do hall (a worship hall): It was built before the middle of the Muromachi period.
Raido (worship hall): It was built before the middle of the Muromachi period.
Raido (worship hall): It was built before the middle of the Muromachi period.

sen.j: 入母屋造り・本瓦葺。
sen.e: It is of irimoya-zukuri style (a style of a hip-and-gable roof construction, or a building with this roof construction) and hongawarabuki style (a style of tile roofing in which round and square tiles are laid down alternately)
Its style is irimoya-zukuri (a hip-and-gable roof construction, or a building with this roof construction) and hongawarabuki (tile roofing in which round and square tiles are laid down alternately).
sen.cmt: Its style で始まる文にしました。
sen.e: Its style is irimoya-zukuri (a hip-and-gable roof construction, or a building with this roof construction) and hongawarabuki (tile roofing in which round and square tiles are laid down alternately).

sen.j: 眼の観音様として親しまれている十一面千手観音菩薩坐像を安置。
sen.e: It enshrines eleven-faced Thousand-armed Kannon Bosatsu zazo (sitting statue of the Kannon) known as kannonsama (Kannon (Kwannon) for eyes.

It enshrines eleven-faced Thousand-armed Kannon Bosatsu zazo (sitting statue of the Kannon) a seated statue of the eleven-faced and one thousand-armed Kannon popular as the miracle-working Kannon-sama for eyes.
sen.cmt: eleven-faced Thousand-armed Kannon Bosatsu zazo (sitting statue of the Kannon) →a seated statue of the eleven-faced and one thousand-armed Kannon known→popular kannonsama (Kannon (Kwannon)→ the miracle-working Kannon-sama
sen.e: It enshrines eleven-faced Thousand-armed Kannon Bosatsu zazo (sitting statue of the Kannon) a seated statue of the eleven-faced and one thousand-armed Kannon popular as the miracle-working Kannon-sama for eyes.

sen.j: 三重塔－室町時代の明応6年（1497年）の建立。
sen.e: Three-storied pagoda: It was built in 1479 in the Muramachi period.
Three-storied pagoda: It was built in 1479 in the Muromachi period.
Three-storied pagoda: It was built in 1479 in the Muromachi period.

sen.j: 近畿日本鉄道近鉄吉野線壺阪山駅から奈良交通バス壺阪山行きで11分。
sen.e: It is a 11 minute drive by bus of Nara Kotsu Bus Lines Co., Ltd bound for Tsubosakazan, which runs from Tsubosakazan Station of Kintetsu Corporation Yoshino Line.

sen.j: 終点下車、徒歩5分。
sen.e: It is a 5 minute walk from the terminal bus stop, Tsubosakazan.

sen.j: 西名阪自動車道郡山インターチェンジ (奈良県)から国道24号、国道169号を経由
sen.e: Get off at Koriyama Interchange (Nara Prefecture) of Nishimeihan Jidoshado Expressway and run National Route 24 and National Route 169.

sen.e: From the Koriyama Interchange exit (Nara Prefecture) of Nishimeihan Jidoshado Expressway, take National Route 24 and National Route 16.
Exit at the Koriyama Interchange (Nara Prefecture) of Nishimeihan Jidoshado Expressway and take National Route 24 and then National Route 169.

sen.j: 壺阪口から奈良県道119号明日香清水寺線2km
sen.e: Enter Nara Prefectural Road No. 119 Asuka-Kiyomizudera line at Tsubosaka-guchi and run 2km.
